title: Honoring Ruth Barone on her retirement from the Town of Amherst Engineering Department after 29 years of distinguished service
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring  Ruth  Barone upon the occasion of her
retirement from the Town of Amherst,  New  York  Engineering  Department
after 29 years of distinguished service

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize and honor
illustrious  citizens  of  this  great  Empire State who have faithfully
served the citizens of their community  with  exemplary  dedication  and
conscientious service; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Ruth
Barone upon the occasion of her retirement from the Town of Amherst, New
York Engineering Department after 29 years of distinguished service; and
  WHEREAS, Ruth Barone moved to Buffalo from Chicago  in  1968  and  has
been a valued and involved member of the Amherst community for more than
40 years; and
  WHEREAS,  Ruth  Barone chaired many PTA events and served as President
of the Eggert Road School PTA when her children were young; she has also
long been active in numerous other community  and  political  activities
and  organizations  including  the  Amherst  Garden Club and the Amherst
Senior Center Foundation Board; and
  WHEREAS, In 1981, Ruth Barone joined the staff of the Town of  Amherst
Engineering  Department  as a part-time Clerk and, in June 1986, went to
work for the department full-time as a Clerk Typist; in  February  1989,
she  was  promoted to the position of Senior Clerk Typist and, in August
1997, to Principal Clerk Typist, the capacity in which she  ably  served
until her well-earned retirement on December 29, 2010; and
  WHEREAS,  Ruth  Barone has served the Town of Amherst, its Engineering
Department and the people of  Amherst  and  Erie  County  with  loyalty,
honor, and distinction; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  her career, she served the Town of Amherst Engi-
neering Department with intelligence and caring dedication, continuously
striving to effectively fulfill the duties of her position; and
  WHEREAS, Ruth Barone  has  served  the  Town  of  Amherst  Engineering
Department  with  great diligence and unswerving commitment, earning the
admiration, esteem and affection of her colleagues  and  community,  who
will  gather,  together  with  her friends and family, at Banchetti's on
Thursday, January 20, 2011, to honor her and to wish her well; and
  WHEREAS, With Ruth Barone throughout  have  been  her  husband  of  45
years,  Frank  Barone, and their children, Christa and Frank, and grand-
children Abigail, Frankie, and Nicholas, all of whom  are  proud  to  be
part of her life and rejoice in her accomplishments; and
  WHEREAS,  In recognition of her commitment, dedication and 29 years of
enthusiastic service, it is the sense of this Legislative Body to extend
its highest commendation to Ruth Barone; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor Ruth Barone upon the occasion of her retirement as Principal Clerk
Typist  of  the  Town  of Amherst Engineering Department and to wish her
well in her well-deserved retirement; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Ruth Barone.
